conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D.
Predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
C flows into F because it mixes with the orange stream from B.
Each coloured stream meets the first baffle it touches and then follows the slope of that baffle.
Successive baffles deflect the stream until it drops between two neighbouring walls above one of the containers E, F, or G.
The cyan stream from A rides the long grey baffle down to the green one, which sends it leftward until it falls into the gap above the red container E.
The orange stream from B lands on the long grey baffle, continues downward along the long pink baffle and then the short black baffle; it finally drops into the second gap, above F.
The yellow stream from C lands on the grey baffle too; from there it merges with the orange stream and follows the same route, ending in F.
The pink stream from D reaches no baffle until it hits the bottom; it falls straight down the right-hand edge into the gap that feeds G.
The lower containers that receive fluid are E from A, F from both B and C, and G from D.
